section: 11. The Managers will jointly decide major issues concerning the Venture. Where Managers are unable to reach agreement in deciding major issues, approval by a majority vote of the Members at a regular or special meeting will be required.
explanation: This section creates an ambiguity because it states that managers will jointly decide major issues, implying unanimous agreement, but then allows for a majority vote of the members if the managers disagree. This creates an internal contradiction as to whether management decisions require unanimity or just a majority vote of the members.

section: JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: There is an inconsistency in the stated contribution of JVLS, LLC. It is described as '$60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government, City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.' However, in Section 15, under Capital Contributions, the same contribution is valued at $3,500,000.00 USD. This creates a significant discrepancy regarding the valuation of JVLS, LLC's contribution.

section: 39. In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined in a manner deemed appropriate by the remaining members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be determined at the discretion of the remaining members.
explanation: This section creates a significant contradiction. It states that in the absence of a written agreement, the 'value of the Venture will be determined in a manner deemed appropriate by the remaining members.' However, it then states that 'A withdrawing Member's interest will be determined at the discretion of the remaining members.' This implies that the remaining members can arbitrarily determine the value of a withdrawing member's interest, even if it contradicts the overall valuation of the Venture. This lacks clarity and fairness.
